author: Scott Patterson
title: Glencore’s Cobalt Sale Helps China’s Drive to Build Electric Vehicles
text:
Glencore PLC has agreed to sell a chunk of its cobalt production to a Chinese company, a person familiar with the matter said, marking another victory for China in a race to lock up supplies of an important metal used in batteries for electric vehicles.
Glencore, the giant Swiss commodity producer and trader, signed a deal several weeks ago to provide more than 50,000 metric tons of cobalt over three years to GEM Co., a Shenzhen-listed chemicals firm, the person said.
